notesStmt.note: Folio 210v: a remedy against a strom on the sea; folio 211r: a formula against robbers. A Latin inscription, partly illegible: folio 1v. Folio 2r & 2v: an index of contents in Latin.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: 21 quires of mostly 10 leaves each, marked by catchwords at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive and square script of the 15th century.

binding.p: Post-1600. Brown blind-tooled leather. Boxed. Spine: 'Tractatus Varii. Hebraice. Brit. Mus. Jure Empt. 19.668.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Adolphus Asher (b. 1800, d. 1853), Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum 1841-1853: purchased from him by the British Museum on 12 November 1853: inscribed, folio [213v].
